title: Sales Specialist Fixed Income Indices
description:
**About the Role:**  

**Grade Level (for internal use):** 11
  
**The role :** Sales Specialist Fixed Income Indices
  
  

**The impact :**  

We are seeking a Fixed Income Indices Sales Specialist to join our Sales Specialist team at S&P Dow Jones Indices in New York. As an Index Sales Specialist, you will focus on growing our integrated Fixed Income, and Loans business across asset managers, ETF issuers, banks, insurance, and other financial institutions. You will be responsible executing the sales strategy to drive annual sales and revenue targets for both core solutions and some of our most innovative Index offerings. You are a proven sales person with knowledge of fixed income benchmarks and passion for determining and satisfying our customer’s goals. You will support and drive sales identification, development and closing of opportunities.
  
  

You will report to the fixed income Sales Specialist lead in North America and will work closely with all parts of the S&P DJI organization, including the client facing Commercial teams (sales, segment specialists), Product, Research, Marketing, Client Services, Legal, etc. You will be an ambassador for S&P DJI and cultivate a high-performance culture of client-centrism, disciplined execution, collaboration, innovation, and integrity. As fixed income investing continues to gain momentum in ETFs and Insurance products, this is an exciting opportunity to be part of a dynamic and growing part of our organization.
  
  

**Responsibilities:**  

**Commercial Strategy :**  

Execute the regional sales strategy to achieve annual sales and revenue targets for Fixed Income and loan Indices and associated index data
  
Collaborate with account-based sales and client segment specialist teams to penetrate and grow Fixed Income index revenues in their named accounts
  
Serve as a subject matter expert across asset managers, investment banks, insurance, and other financial institutions with ability to articulate specialized Fixed Income risk managed product strategies, positioning and rationale, performance drivers, etc.
  
Develop deep expertise with S&P DJI’s products as well as continually educate oneself and Commercial teams to maintain strong product knowledge of the full suite of available and developing Indices, their integration points with other Indices products, and competitors
  
  

**Sales & Business Development:**  

Joint responsibility in partnership with the regional client coverage teams for the sale and retention of Fixed Income Index offerings in the region
  
Serve as an architect, providing guidance to help form a holistic suite of Indices for clients (the blending of managed strategies), based on S&P DJI’s market views but customized according to client preference
  
Collaborate across different product and sales teams to deliver the right suite of solutions for each client
  
Work closely with regional client coverage teams to drive new investment flows and retain existing businesses, evaluating flow trends across regions and pivoting focus accordingly
  
Participate in regional cross-functional/cross-team pod meetings weekly, quarterly, and annually
  
Leverage product, market, and technical expertise to build and maintain credibility with clients, identify gaps, and recommend solutions; and deliver on revenue-generating goals
  
Shared accountability for achieving revenue and market share growth targets
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

5+ years of successful track record in a sales, relationship management and/or revenue generation role, with experience of Fixed Income products and solutions. Loans experience beneficial but not mandatory
  
Bachelor’s degree required
  
Industry knowledge of credit fixed income solutions
  
Results driven– owns partnerships as key enablers to deliver business objectives
  
Strong consultative sales approach and capabilities; experience in solutions selling
  
Ability to drive growth through proven sales results, from prospecting to pitching to closing
  
Ability to stay on top of evolving Risk Management and Fixed Income Index market trends with desire to continually learn and add new technical and selling skills
  
Effectively operate in a highly team-oriented and collaborative environment
  
Strong presentation, strategic thinking, interpersonal, negotiation and closing skills
  
  

**Critical Experiences:**  

B2B financial services and Fixed Income sales experience with established history of revenue generation
  
Experience with contracts, commercials, and fee proposals
  
Multi-tasker, rapid thinker and globally minded professional with proven capabilities to collaborate within a sales team to deliver
  
Demonstrated ability to educate colleagues and clients and drive sales outcomes
  
Experience achieving results through influence and cross-functional collaboration internally and externally
  
Experience engaging with a range of players across organizations from Sales to Product Managers, etc.
  
Proven ability to work efficiently in a collaborative selling environment while maximizing resources available to achieve success
  
  

Flexible Working
  
We pride ourselves on our agility and diversity, and we welcome requests to work flexibly. For most roles, flexible hours and/or an element of remote working are usually possible. Please talk to us at interview about the type of arrangement that is best for you. We will always try to be adaptable wherever we can.
  
  

Return to Work
  
Have you taken time out for caring responsibilities and are now looking to return to work? As part of our Return to Work initiative (link to career site page when available), we are encouraging enthusiastic and talented returners to apply, and will actively support your return to the workplace.
  
  

**Compensation/Benefits Information (US Applicants Only):**  

S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $100,000 to $135,000. Base salary ranges may vary by geographic location. In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for additional compensation such as a semi-annual incentive bonus plan.
  
This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, visit https://www.spgbenefitessentials.com/newhires.
  
  

About S&P Global Dow Jones Indic e s
  
At S&P Dow Jones Indices, we provide iconic and innovative index solutions backed by unparalleled expertise across the asset-class spectrum. By bringing transparency to the global capital markets, we empower investors everywhere to make decisions with conviction. We’re the largest global resource for index-based concepts, data and research, and home to iconic financial market indicators, such as the S&P 500 ® and the Dow Jones Industrial Average ® . More assets are invested in products based upon our indices than any other index provider in the world. With over USD 7.4 trillion in passively managed assets linked to our indices and over USD 11.3 trillion benchmarked to our indices, our solutions are widely considered indispensable in tracking market performance, evaluating portfolios and developing investment strategies.
  
**S&P Dow Jones Indices is a division of S&P Global (NYSE:** SPGI). S&P Global is the world’s foremost provider of credit ratings, benchmarks, analytics and workflow solutions in the global capital, commodity and automotive markets. With every one of our offerings, we help many of the world’s leading organizations navigate the economic landscape so they can plan for tomorrow, today. title: Payment Poster and RCM Support
description:
**POSITION SUMMARY**


This position utilizes knowledge of insurance regulations, medical coding, and bookkeeping to successfully post and reconcile insurance payments in a timely manner, as well as perform a variety of revenue cycle management support activities.  



  

**PRIMARY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES** (Essential Functions of the Position include but are not limited to the following. Other duties may be assigned)**.**

**Payment Posting**

* Posting of electronic remits with resubmittal errors and/or provider level adjustments.
* Pulling and manipulating 835 data to make complex posting more efficient and reliable.
* Identification and resolution of unapplied insurance payments.
* Posting of paper payments including pulling paper remits from various portals for enrollment delays.

**Management and Maintenance of Automatic Posting**

About the role
  
  

The Vice President of Data Management and Governance reports into the Global Head of Data Management & Governance. The most prominent component of the position is to serve as the Product Owner for the enterprise Master Data Management (MDM) strategy, ecosystem & associated platforms, processes, and overall operating model by defining, directing, implementing, and continuing to enhance the MDM roadmap, business architecture, and end state vision aligning with corporate objectives. With this ownership comes the responsibility for maintaining and servicing a 24/7 operational production system along with the management of business analysts and MDM stewards in support of it. Additionally, this role will be responsible for the management of 3rd party/market data and instituting as well as enforcing, data controls and standards as part of a specifically defined governance framework. The role will also be responsible for mastery, custodianship, and deep level of understanding of additional data domains across the enterprise in support of both underwriting and claims life cycle processes. The ability to navigate across a wide variety of stakeholders, geographies, and business units in underwriting, claims, operations, as well as other functions and downstream consumers is essential.
  
  

**What you need to know:**  

**MDM Core Responsibilities:** Lead and manage the MDM vision and strategy in line with the Global Head of Data Management & Governance’s priorities and objectives. Create a strong and seamless partnership with the MDM IT owner in delivering next horizon MDM objectives. Partner with Data Office Architecture, other Data Management & Governance leaders, as well as business and functional leaders in articulating and implementing the MDM strategy. Execute action plans and strategies for further expansion of MDM usage to drive business use and maintenance of the best version of truth for critical domains. Continue to commercialize the MDM offering and identify new opportunities to persist the usage of master data.
  
**Operating Model:** Continuously define and improve the MDM operating model including people, process, and technology across the organization and throughout the entire data lifecycle - ensuring the most effective and efficient outcomes. Identify and achieve correct levels of maturity that align with overarching corporate objectives and end state visions.
  
**Business Ownership of MDM Platform:** Assert business ownership of the MDM platform identifying and driving further implementation aspects, organization of, prioritization, and enhancements of platform capabilities and impacted processes. Support the technical owners of the platform from the perspective of prioritizing, planning, implementing, and testing both necessary defect fixes and strategic enhancements, setting up new features, and assisting with upgrades.
  
**Master Data Governance:** Ensure the catalog of reference data is current with complete business and technical metadata (e.g. business terms, definitions at table and column level). Support Reference Data Governance activities on Collibra – Catalog, Audit, Capture of Consumer/Stakeholder/methods and semi-annual recertification. Additionally, support evaluation/exploration of alternative capabilities, as/if needed. Support development of Data Governance Program execution health metrics in support of communicating overall program health using quantitative and qualitative data.
  
**Align with Other Data Management Disciplines:** Engage with the Data Governance, Data Stewardship, Data Quality, Reference Data Management, Data Architecture, BI and Data Warehousing, Data Science, and other teams to ensure MDM activity aligns as needed with other capability needs including the Global Data Governance Accountability Framework. Ensure collaboration and consistency across these teams and in conversations with similar stakeholders.
  
**Team Management:** Manage a team of approximately eight (8) data professionals in multiple locations (currently 5 in New Hampshire, 1 in Texas, 1 in New York, and 1 in New Jersey) providing guidance, advice, direction, expertise, and support on priorities for the MDM center of excellence. The role will facilitate an embedded culture that is dedicated to staff training, re-skilling, development, and opportunity creation.
  
**Standards, Best Practices, and Procedures:** Further define, develop and maintain MDM standards, best practices, and procedures. Conduct periodic reviews of MDM to ensure compliance with the data governance standards and policies and identify where are updates or new standards and policies are required.
  
**Data Culture and Communication:** Partner with our Data Culture and Communications Lead in designing and defining training and communications to ensure an excellent customer experience with our team and our tools. Ensure change management and stakeholder communication on MDM changes as applicable. Educate owners, stewards, and consumers of data on their role in governance and ensure compliance.
  
  

**What we’re looking for:**  

Undergraduate degree in a relevant field or proven record of experience in Data Management and Governance roles. MS a plus but not required.
  
Strong understanding of principles, procedures, and skills associated with Data Management and Governance concepts and practices - preferably in a large Property & Casualty Insurance company or other complex Financial Services setting. Certified Data Management Professional (CDMP) or other comparable certification is desirable.
  
Superb and proven people management skills with no less than 10+ years managing and leading teams in dynamic and high stress environments with tight timelines and competing priorities.
  
Proficiency in administration, design, and development with data management and governance tools.
  
Demonstrated experience with Data Management and Governance Platforms such as Collibra, Informatica Axon/Catalog, IBM Infosphere, Waterline Data, etc.
  
10 + years in a large corporate environment, preferably a Property and Casualty Insurance company with a deep level of expertise in the underwriting lifecycle process.
  
Team player with a highly motivated, positive, and collaborative attitude.
  
Superior verbal and written communication and presentation skills with a high degree of attention to detail.
  
Strategic thinker with ability to understand and execute the long-term ("big picture") and short-term perspectives of situations.
  
Excellent organizational skills with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment, with changing priorities and the ability to effectively prioritize multiple tasks to meet tight deadlines.
  
Solid program and project management skills (preferably Agile methodology) with ability to manage diverse projects impacting multiple roles and processes.
  
Ability to influence change and drive results. Must be a self-motivated driver to identify issues and resolve them quickly.
  
Ability to provide vision and direction in management level reporting using aggregated profiling and assessment results of various data sets as it pertains to Master Data.
  
Ability to troubleshoot problem areas, identify gaps and issues, and remediate.
  
Ability to provide necessary business context and objectives to enable architects, technical and business system analysts to formulate and implement technical solutions
  
High level/advanced proficiency of MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access, Visio)
  
  

Veterans are encouraged to apply.
